title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
content:
{{similar|Alice in Wonderland}}
{{versions
|title=Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
|author=Lewis Carroll
|notes=A novel by [[Author:Lewis Carroll|Lewis Carroll]] first published in 1865.}}[[File:Alice par John Tenniel 02.png|thumb|right|The White Rabbit, illustration by [[Author:John Tenniel|John Tenniel]]]] 
* ''[[Alice's Adventures Under Ground]]'' (1864), manuscript illustrated by [[Author:Lewis Carroll|Lewis Carroll]].
* ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (1866)|Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]'' (1866), illustrated by [[Author:John Tenniel|John Tenniel]].
* ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (1901)|Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]'' (1901), illustrated by [[Author:Peter Newell|Peter Newell]]
* ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (1907)|Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]'' (1907), illustrated by [[Author:Charles Robinson (1870-1937)|Charles Robinson]].
* ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (Rackham)|Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]'' (1907), illustrated by [[Author:Arthur Rackham|Arthur Rackham]]

===Adaptations===
* ''[[Alice in Wonderland (1903 film)|Alice in Wonderland]]'' (1903), silent film adaptation.
* ''[[Alice in Wonderland in Words of One Syllable]]'' (1905), adapted by [[Author:J. C. Gorham|J. C. Gorham]].

===Individual poems===
* "[[All in the Golden Afternoon]]"
* "[[You Are Old, Father William]]"

===See also=== 
* ''[[Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There]]'' (1871), Carroll's sequel.
* ''[[Alice in Blunderland]]'' (1907), parody by [[Author:John Kendrick Bangs|John Kendrick Bangs]].
